activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Refugio J. Guerra Jr.

records.addlTxt:
1:25 PM Defendant Refugio J. Guerra Jr. in court.  Attorney Walter Isaacson, for attorney Shanna Sanders, in court for Refugio J. Guerra Jr.  Attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders bond conditions amended to change curfew to 10 pm  to 6 am.  
Calendar call scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

May not possess any weapons. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any paraphernalia. Defendant to be in residence from 10 pm to 6 am unless at work or traveling to and from work.
Calendar call on September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:00 AM Defendant Refugio J. Guerra Jr. in court by audio with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity:Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:09 P PM Defendant Refugio J. Guerra Jr. in court by video in custody with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $2000 set with conditions of may not possess any weapons. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any paraphernalia. Defendant to be in residence from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.

May not possess any weapons. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any paraphernalia. Defendant to be in residence from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work.
